ca.ualberta.cs.scandaloutraveltracker.models

Class Claim

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.scandaloutraveltracker.models.SModel
      • ca.ualberta.cs.scandaloutraveltracker.models.Claim
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Claim>

    public class Claim
extends SModel
implements java.lang.Comparable<Claim>
    Class that contains the Claim model. Edits to any instance of a Claim should be done through the ClaimController class.
    Author:
    Team3ScandalouStopwatch

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Claim()
      Constructor that is used to create empty claims to fill for the NewClaimActivity

      Fetches a claim corresponding to the id passed to it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Claim

        public Claim(int id)
        Fetches a claim corresponding to the id passed to it. Uses the ClaimMapper class to retrieve the saved claim.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the claim. This is created whenever a new Claim is created and is how the ClaimMapper class knows which claim is which when saved.
        See Also:
        ClaimMapper.loadClaimData(int, String)

      • Claim

        public Claim()
        Constructor that is used to create empty claims to fill for the NewClaimActivity

      • updateClaim

        public void updateClaim(java.util.Date startDate,
               java.util.Date endDate,
               java.lang.String description,
               java.util.ArrayList<Destination> destinations,
               boolean canEdit)
                 throws UserInputException
        The updateClaim method takes any of the fields that can be changed by a claimant and updates the claim by using the claim's id along with a claimMapper.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Claim's start date
        endDate - Claim's end date
        description - Claim's description
        destinations - Claim's destinations
        canEdit - If the claim can be edited
        Throws:
        UserInputException
        See Also:
        ClaimMapper.updateClaim(int, Date, Date, String, ArrayList, boolean)

      • updateExpenses

        public void updateExpenses(java.util.ArrayList<Expense> expenses)
                    throws UserInputException
        Throws:
        UserInputException

      • updateTags

        public void updateTags(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tags)
        Updates the list of tags associated with the claim. Uses the ClaimMapper to save the updated tag values and notifies the views associated with the Claim to update.
        Parameters:
        tags - Claim's tags
        See Also:
        ClaimMapper.updateTags(int, ArrayList)

      • submitClaim

        public void submitClaim()
        Updates the Claim to the properties that are associated with a submitted claim. This is, setting the status to submitted and canEdit boolean to false. Uses the ClaimMapper to save updated data.

      • approveClaim

        public void approveClaim(java.lang.String approverName,
                java.lang.String comment,
                int claimId)
        Approves the Claim. This is, setting the status to approved and canEdit boolean to false. Uses the ClaimMapper to save updated data.

      • returnClaim

        public void returnClaim(java.lang.String approverName,
               java.lang.String comment,
               int claimId)
        Returns the Claim. This is, setting the status to returned and canEdit boolean to true. Uses the ClaimMapper to save updated data.

        Parameters:
        destination - Claim's destination if claim status is returned or in progress

      • computeTotal

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> computeTotal()
        Uses a HashMap to calculate the total cost of the claim. The string value is associated with the currency and the double is associated with the cost. If the currency types match, they are added together, else if they dont match a new group is opened fo that currency type else if no currency selected, the amount is added to other.
        Returns:
        HashMap with totaled costs from expenses

      • destinationsToString

        public java.lang.String destinationsToString()
        Converts all the destinations associated with a claim into a string. The format of this string is: destination1, destination2, ..., destination x
        Returns:
        A string with the Claim's destination names

        public int getProgress()
